title: Firefox Dev Edition Defaults to Italics
content:
Hi there,

I've just downloaded the dev version of Firefox, and for some reason some of the text defaults to italics; I can't see where to change this. On all other browsers, this text is not italic.

Does anyone have an explanation / solution?

The non-italic text in the picture attached is the 'good text' which accurately reflects itself accross browsers and devices. The italic text is the 'bad text' that I want to change for consistency.

Thanks!
creator: Korinthos

title: How can I re-enable prompts on Thingiverse?
content: When editing my collection on Thingiverse, there was an annoying "Are you sure?" prompt every time I deleted an item. I checked a box to disable these prompts in Firefox, but now I am unable to edit my collection at all. Where can I find the setting to re-enable these prompts?
creator: H.E.L.P.e.R.

title: Firefox jako jediný nenačte stránku
content:
Dobrý den, webová stránka www.mujparacord.cz načte pouze hlavní úvodní stranu. Pokud si rozkliknu jednotlivé kategorie, vidím pouze točící se kolečko a chat vpravo dole, ale obsah se nenačte. Na tento problém upozornili zákazníci, kteří mají Firefox. Testoval jsem stránku na Google Chrome, Opera, Microsoft Edge a Internet Explorer a problém je pouze u Mozilla Firefox a Internet Explorer, který je už delší dobu bez podpory. Čím to může být způsobeno?

Děkuji za odpověď

title: Firefox browser not loading pages or setting
content:
Yesterday I was using the firefox browser normally and suddenly it stopped working. Now it does not load any websites (see picture). Also, to access the preferences tab if I do it by clicking on the menu, sometimes it opens up just fine but others it does not react. Same if I type in about:preferences.

I have tried the following:

- Refreshing firefox - Using firefox in private mode - Deleting all extensions - Using default system theme - Selecting no proxy in the network settings - Reinstalling firefox - Clearing recent history - Setting network.dns.disableIPv6 and network.dns.disablePrefetch to True

Nothing is working... I have looked everywhere for a solution, please help!!
creator: maiteetxandi

title: FireFox browser video's closed-caption order problem
content:
In playing stream video with closed caption in FireFox browser, Closed-Caption is displaying in reversed order.

for example, If Actors says "Hi everybody, <Line Feed> I'm gonna give you one of my favorite"

Firefox browser's closed caption shows this way. Old caption is located below. "I'm gonna give you one of my favorite <Line Feed> Hi everybody, "

Chrome browser or other browser don't have same problem. works well.
creator: whitebrownie

title: Firefox won't launch
content: When I try to launch Firefox, I get an error message that Firefox is running but not responding and buttons to Close Firefox or Cancel. Closing Firefox results in a pause, then the error message reappearing. When I monitor in Task Manager, I see 2 Firefox processes. One closes when I click Close Firefox, then reappears before the error message reappears. If I close both processes before launching Firefox, two new processes appear with the error message. I can't open Firefox in troubleshooting mode. I have uninstalled and reinstalled, still can't launch.
creator: 12pixelpete

title: Black or partially black window after minimize/restore with AutoHotkey
content:
Hi, this is my first time asking for help :-)

I use an AutoHotkey script to activate the Firefox window with a keyboard shortcut, e.g. Win+W, to avoid having to cycle through all the windows with alt-tab. Here's the script:

  1. w::

WinActivate ahk_exe C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe Return

It works great when I just switch from any window/app to Firefox. However, when I minimize Firefox, for example to show the desktop with Win+D, then I restore/activate Firefox with my Win+W hotkey, the Firefox window appears entirely black (even the chrome area) or 3/4 black.

By 3/4, I mean that if you divide the window in 4 quadrants, only the first (top left) quadrant is automatically redrawn. The remaining 3 are black.

Sometimes it takes a few seconds before it repaints itself, it's just very slow. Other times, I have to move the mouse over the "chrome" area. Moving the mouse over the content has no effect. Sometimes I press ALT or WIN key twice to make it repaint itself.

At first, I considered this bug a minor issue and thought it would get fixed soon, but after several months, maybe more than a year, I got tired of it. So, I begin by asking here.

To avoid wasting time, I'm not a novice user. I've used Firefox/Mozilla/Netscape for 20+ years. I've tried a new, clean profile without extensions or customization. I've got the latest NVIDIA driver. I've tried disabling HW acceleration. Several versions of Firefox are affected. Release and Developer Edition branches. Other apps/browsers are not.

This issue isn't with AutoHotkey since I've tried another hotkey tool with the same result. And I've already asked on their forum.

I believe this simply exposed a hidden bug in Firefox. Painting is not triggered in some cases. I really hope someone here can reproduce this. I'm not ready to file a bug on Bugzilla yet.

My OS is Windows 10 Pro x64, 21H1 (19043.1288), but of course I had an earlier version when the issue began. Same for Firefox, currently 94.0.1 but this problem isn't new. My HW is Intel i5/8GB/GeForce GTX 760.

The red rectangle in the screenshot has been added by me for privacy. The black color is really how it looks.
creator: hixevi8659
